name: Utah Jazz
history: Founded in New Orleans in 1974, the team moved to Salt Lake City in 1979 but kept the 'Jazz' name despite Utah having no jazz history. The franchise became a Western Conference powerhouse in the 1990s behind the pick-and-roll duo of John Stockton and Karl Malone, reaching two NBA Finals. They consistently field competitive teams and enjoy one of the loudest home-court advantages in the league due to the arena's acoustics. The Jazz are known for stability, having had only two head coaches (Jerry Sloan and Quin Snyder) span a 33-year period.
fun_facts: The team kept the name 'Jazz' after moving from New Orleans, even though Utah is not known for jazz music.
John Stockton leads the NBA all-time in both assists and steals, records that are considered nearly unbreakable.
Mark Eaton holds the NBA record for most blocked shots in a single season with 456.
Karl Malone and John Stockton played 1,412 regular-season games together, an NBA record for teammates.
Michael Jordan's famous 'Flu Game' and his 'Last Shot' both occurred against the Jazz in the NBA Finals.
